db:abstract.db:para: The DateTimeAxis element is used for manipulating chart's axes.

db:section.db:title: Detailed Description
db:section.db:para: The labels can be configured by setting an appropriate DateTime format. Note that any date before 4714 BCE or after about 1.4 million CE may not be accurately stored. DateTimeAxis can be setup to show axis line with tick marks, grid lines and shades.

db:section.db:title: format : string
db:section.db:para: The format string that is used when creating label for the axis out of a QDateTime object. Check QDateTime documentation for information on how the string should be defined.

db:section.db:title: max : datetime
db:section.db:para: Defines the maximum value on the axis. When setting this property the min is adjusted if necessary, to ensure that the range remains valid.

db:section.db:title: min : datetime
db:section.db:para: Defines the minimum value on the axis. When setting this property the max is adjusted if necessary, to ensure that the range remains valid.

db:section.db:title: tickCount : int
db:section.db:para: The number of tick marks for the axis.

db:section.db:title: onFormatChanged(string format)
db:section.db:para: Axis emits signal when format of the axis has changed.

db:section.db:title: onMaxChanged(datetime max)
db:section.db:para: Axis emits signal when max of axis has changed.

db:section.db:title: onMinChanged(datetime min)
db:section.db:para: Axis emits signal when min of axis has changed.

db:section.db:title: tickCountChanged(int tickCount)
db:section.db:para: Axis emits signal when tickCount number on axis have changed.
